result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A Sorensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: ct 2

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle A Sorensen in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing on August 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 28, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Supplemental Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Jury trial - 12 person on August 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.

3:35 Defendant Kyle A Sorensen in court with attorney Melissa H Dalkert.  Kelly A Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Rochley Gross is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lehn. He is high school liaison police officer with the City of Marshfield. In September of 2013, he was given a report to follow up on. He had contact with the defendant regarding this incident. BJS indicated he received physical injuries from defendant. The incident occurred at a residence in the City of Marshfield. Defendant's wife reported that the amount of force used by defendant was excessive. He had bruising on his buttocks. He was examined at the Plover Family Practice Center. Attorney Dalkert cross-examines witness. 
Cindy Lowe is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lehn. She is a social worker with the Wood County Human Services Dept. In July of 2013, she received a report of alleged child abuse against BJS from Marathon County. She did follow up investigation. She interviewed the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Attorney Dalkert cross examines witness. 
Attorney Lehn makes statement.
Attorney Dalkert makes statement.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 5, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

3:36 Defendant Kyle A Sorensen in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Witness is not available and parties agree to waive time limits and matter will be reset for preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant and he agrees to waive time limits. Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 10, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
no unsupervised contact with BJS and to comply with any order regarding that case.
Defendant Kyle A Sorensen in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert.  Craig Steven Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
